title: Socialist Party (France)
summary: The Socialist Party (French: Parti socialiste [paʁti sɔsjalist], PS) is a centre-left,[3][4][5] social-democratic[6] political party in France. The PS was for decades the largest party of the French centre-left and used to be one of the two major political parties in the French Fifth Republic, along with The Republicans. It replaced the earlier French Section of the Workers' International in 1969 and is currently led by First Secretary Olivier Faure. The PS is a member of the Party of European Socialists, Progressive Alliance and Socialist International.
